poem:
Title: A Ball and A Dream

Kicking sorrow's echo through the maze,
Underdog souls in jersey's blaze.
Lines drawn in dust, dreams on the pitch,
Each strike and miss, touching life's stitch.
Barefoot, yet shod in poverty's grip,
Searching salvation in each skilful trip.
A cup not of silver, but courage-steeled,
In the vast field of human yield.
